letters.description: Conduct a thorough assessment of the client's current cognitive function, lifestyle, and health history to establish a baseline and identify areas for improvement.
Identify and challenge limiting beliefs about brain health and cognitive potential, replacing them with empowering perspectives.
Develop a personalized action plan with specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART) goals related to nutrition, exercise, sleep, stress management, and cognitive stimulation.
Support the client in integrating brain-healthy habits into their daily routine, providing ongoing guidance and accountability.
Employ advanced coaching techniques to facilitate neuroplasticity, fostering cognitive resilience and adaptability through continuous learning and mental exercises.
